review.itemreviewed: TPS 535 Lth V Evo Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am a 10 year Veteran of Utah County Search & Rescue.   I’ve used this shoe’s predecessor on 100s of aggressive backcountry callouts (scree slopes, rock climbing, extreme winter conditions & more) and these shoes provided optimal comfort and support.  I have tried a few other hiking shoes but always went back to these.  After 16 years the sole on one of the shoes suffered some collapse and while I still use them I have decided to buy one more pair and when I say one more pair I mean they will last until I cannot hike anymore.
review.name: Best Hiking Shoe Ever Owned

review.itemreviewed: TPS 535 Lth V Evo Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair. The first pair lasted about 6 years.
review.name: Great Boots

review.reviewBody: I have one of these, i've bought it many years ago, and it works great. Some scuffs, but nothing big. The price since then, increased very much
review.name: Good but could be better price

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit, and weight for higher output active stuff in cooler weather like running, biking, ski touring. It ventilates very well. The only small concern I have is some fraying of the flat stitching if there are friction points with other layers on top - will see how this goes over time. I’m 5’11” 180# and wear a medium. Snug but not too tight
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: I bought this one for hiking, but I realized right away that it was the perfect garment for winter cycling! I get too hot in shells, so the slight air through of this hoody keeps me at the perfect temperature in the 35s to 55s. I took it hiking and was also amazed! Combined with a rain jacket is perfect when you are in the shade, but take the shell off while you're activelly moving and you are perfect. The red color litterally pops in every picture. Its perfect! I specially like the fit of the hood. Highly recommend this product
review.name: Perfect for cold conditions! The ultimate fit!

review.reviewBody: Overpriced but the red color was 50% off. It is a great mid layer, thin as others have mentioned, but perfect for mild weather. The hood keeps my neck warm when it's down. I like the thumb holes and chest pocket. I'm 6'3" 210 lbs and have a 44/45 in chest. I was worried the large size would be too tight so I ordered an XL. It bunches up a bit in the abdomen but otherwise fits well.
review.name: Very nice mid layer

review.reviewBody: This is my second generation of this jacket and I love it. I bought 2 this time. Super light weight and warm. It has done me good on many adventures!
review.name: Men’s Coefficient Hoody

review.reviewBody: Used on Mt. Baker ascent last weekend. Great midlayer.
review.name: Great midlayer

review.reviewBody: Over the years the colors may change but the performance doesn’t. A solid staple that I rely on
review.name: Solid staple

review.reviewBody: I’m glad I got the regular coefficient hoody vs the LT version. It's thin and the fleece texture on the inside breaths well. The LT version must feel like a sun shirt. This slim cut (fitted) jacket is perfect for high output exercise. This is not your typical thick fleece. Love the hood for under my climbing helmet and the thumb holes for running. I’m 6’ 197 lbs lean.
review.name: Great lite mid layer

review.reviewBody: This is good for days ranging from 35-50 ish on its own, and great for layering in many other conditions. I’m 5’10, 160 lbs and medium fits well.
review.name: Good mid-layer.

review.reviewBody: Love this hoody, waist pockets would be a nice addition
review.name: Great

name: CoEfficient Fleece Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I think it's unfair to give these boots a low rating just because they run small. I'm an 8.5/9 in street shoes and at least a 9/9.5 in most hiking boots and shoes, but in these I had to take a 10. Totally worth it! They're the perfect marriage of a lightweight and flexible, yet decently supportive upper and a burly, sticky, rugged sole. Would I wear these to carry a super heavy load over multiple days? No. But for just about everything else, they're perfect. The heel lock cable system is incredible. Once I got the laces dialed in, my heel has never slipped. They're very comfortable once broken in (do it slowly, which I learned the hard way!) and they served me well on a rainy, challenging 7-day Kilimanjaro expedition. I didn't slip once on wet rock, dirt, mud, or packed snow, and I felt confident in my footing when we had to traverse some inherently slippery loose scree and slush on the steep descent. Highly recommend!!
review.name: Fabulous boots!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Trainer Lite Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I desperately wanted to like them and I probably would have had they not been too small. I ordered my usual size (10) as they didn't have a 10.5. It fit like a 9. Too bad because they would have worked well for my narrow feet.
review.name: Too Small

name: Mountain Trainer Lite Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

description: Buy the Gregory Katmai 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Katmai 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Katmai 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Katmai 55L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Katmai 55L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I do really like my backpack - The side zipper entrance is a game changer! Its very comfortable to wear for long periods. If you are doing multiple days maybe get the 60 or 65L. The pockets on the hips are not able to be closed one handed so you need to reach across your body to close the zipper which is not the most convenient thing when you have 50 lbs in the pack.
review.name: Very Nice Pack!

review.reviewBody: Used for my rim to rim grand canyon hike and it worked great! Very comfy with around 24 lbs of gear. Such a great pack for the price.

I just hiked 5 miles at Kings Mountain state park for a gear shakeout for a trip to Utah. I'm extremely impressed with the pack overall. As a 6 ft 2 in 300lb dude it was a game changer from my Kelty coyote 80 I've used for 13 years. Can't say enough good so far!

I received this pack 2 days before embarking on a 150 mile trek through the backcountry of Yellowstone NP. This pack more than provided for all of my needs. Extremely comfortable, and extremely durable. I really put this pack through the the ringer, adding to my adventure with miles through Grand Teton NP and Badlands NP. This pack accommodated all of the various needs. 
Will be once again strapping up with this pack this weekend for an Appalachian Trail section hike, and a thru hike of the Foothills Trail.
review.name: The Perfect Pack!!

review.reviewBody:
I got this pack about 3 weeks ago and I have tested it out several times. It is a very simple and easy-to-use pack with great features and comfort. It is easy to adjust the torso length and various straps, and all of the storage compartments work well. If you are looking for something to keep you comfortable and happy on the trail this is the way to go! Definitely for longer trips where you would need a BV 500 or more gear. 

In the last month, this pack has been used in the Sierra's, Humbolt-Toiyabe national forest in Nevada, and Pine Valley in Utah on 2+ night backpacking trips.

I have never been disappointed by anything I have used from Gregory, and this bag has been a solid piece of gear. 10/10 would recommend!
review.name: Great pack. Solid choice for 3+ days on the trail!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack to replace an old Gregory forester that lived a happy life but has now passed on. I'm pretty stoked! Super comfy! Light! Nice color! Tons of storage! And holds the weight and stuff I need for backpack trips. I bought a Jade pack for my wife and she's just as stoked as I am.
review.name: Great pack

name: Katmai 55L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody:
A bike repair and assembly stand that doubles as a fixed frame surrounded by hard shell. Its another genius product from Thule. The only let down are the flimsy handles with zero support around the area they are affixed to the case. Mine broke off after a single use. 

Its a sad let down for such a high design product, but I would recommend it as the best bike transport available on the market today.
review.name: Almost perfection, genius design.

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: I love my Thule hard case- I’ve schlepped my bike all over the place to ride (Delta accepts it as a regular checked bag). OK… 60ish lbs is a bit rough to lug around and any rental car has to be a huge SUV to fit the thing on the other end of the flight, but so easy to use and so nice to be mobile. Taking it to Nice to watch the TdF this summer. Love it.
review.name: Best. Bike. Case. On. Earth.

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: this purchase could not have been more difficult,.
review.name: dealing with back Country was an excerse

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: You want something shipped, it's a disaster. Bot calls, lack of response from sales reps and missed gifts ordered 30 days before the Holidays and lost somewhere. My first time and now the last time ordering from Back Country
review.name: Shipping

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody:
When I tell my wife it will only be 30 minutes to pack the bike, she believes me now. Used to take me a whole lot longer. 

One of the easiest travel cases I have ever worked with. Worth the cost. Safe, secure, and not a pain to take the bike apart.
review.name: No longer lying to wife about “30min packing time”

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: Super simple to use and very safe for the bike. Much better than the competitor’s box.
review.name: Best bike box ever!

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: I've had a hard time deciding between getting a soft padded case vs hard case for my bike. I went with a hard case because I want that extra peace of mind that my bike would be protected during the transport. Yes it is heavy, and I don't mind paying the overbaggage fee vs opening the case and seeing my bike wrecked. I haven't used the case yet for travelling but I can tell it is bullet proof enough to withstand the baggage handlers throwing it around and getting slammed around the plane's cargo area. If you want the peace of mind that your precious bike will be in one piece when you get to your destination, go for a hard case, and the Thule Transition is one of the best cases out there. I like how it has the stands to transform it into a bike repair stand, may need to put foam padding on where the straps would go onto the bike to avoid rubbing.
review.name: Great case

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody:
The hardshell RoundTrip bike case is extremely good at protecting your frame/components. Period. Tradeoffs are the following:
1. not great for rolling place-to-place on the back of just a set of small rear wheels
2. rear wheels cracked on cobblestone roads while traveling across EU
3. plastic handles for pulling case break off because the screws loosen easily
4. connecting the 2 halves of the case is lousy especially when airline baggage inspectors open and attempt to reconnect case
5. the internal bike stand has a thru-bolt that defaced the paint on the tip of my fork
6. bike case is extremely heavy and you'll probably pay airline for exceeding weight threshold
review.name: Protect but not very portable

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody: Good bike box. Lots of room and seems to travel well. My Orbea front wheel skewer did not fit the adapters supplied. Had to pull one from an older bike in order to do a lock down.
review.name: Bike Box Review

review.itemreviewed: Round Trip Transition Bike Travel Case
review.reviewBody:
After using the Transition case to fly from MA to Colorado and back, all of my initial doubts about the case were eliminated.  A truly easy case to travel with!

Yes, it is a bit larger and heavier than traditional clamshell cases, but not significantly.  About 20 inches DIM larger (L W H) and about 5lbs heavier.  My  brother traveled the same trip with a clamshell case   great case, but the Transition's vertical orientation and rail mount system proved to be much more travel friendly.

Little disassembly of my bike was required to fit in the Transition case. The front wheel was removed and the forks locked into the fork mount rail.   I pulled the rear wheel and swapped in a spare rear hub/cassette/skewer and left my rear derailleur mounted.  This protected my rear triangle and tensioned the chain to keep it from damaging the frame.  I also removed the saddle/post and handlebar/stem.  Bar/stem was zip tied to top tube and forks.  Entire frame was covered with pipe foam, but since the case does not contact the frame, this was for extra precaution only.   Wheelset was placed in the provided wheel bags and the top cover was locked in place using the two ratchet buckles.  I secured a TSA combination lock through the D rings.

TSA opened and inspected the Transition case in both directions, but there was no evidence of inspection, other than the TSA information tag inside.  Usually cases (ski, bicycle, etc.) are not repacked or sealed the same after TSA inspection.  I assume because of the simplicity of closure, the Transition case was completely resealed exactly as I had packed it.  Conversely, my brother's clamshell case had 4 straps left unsecured by TSA.  

The baggage handlers in Denver commented how easy the case was for them to handle when they returned it to me.  The Transition case has a few very minor scuffs after travel, but unless inspected closely it still looks new.  All hardware and handles remained securely attached and survived the trip with no damage.

The vertical orientation of the Transition case makes it very stable  and easy to maneuver. Most cases roll in a horizontal position, which can make navigating narrow spaces and crowded airport terminals challenging.  The Transition case is about 6 inches taller than clamshell cases, but it rolled (upright) into the rear of a minivan with plenty of clearance.  I did have to lay the case on its side to transport in a midsize SUV.

Upon arrival at my destination, I slid the stem/bar back on the steerer, realigned, and set proper torque.  Did the same with post/saddle  I removed the hub/cassette assembly and fitted my rear wheel.  Finally, I removed the bike from the rail mount and installed my front wheel.  Ready to ride!

For the parts of my trip where transportation of bike by vehicle was required, I used the open (top removed) Transition case as a rail mount carrier in the back of a mini van.  A very stable and protected way to transport that only required removal of the front and rear wheels.

Seeing how well the Transition case traveled to my destination, I no longer had ANY doubts about traveling with the Transition.  

Only suggestion might be a backup strap (rubber or velcro) to lock the rear of the rail into the bottom of the case   just as a precaution in case the primary lock mechanism is dislodged by large impact.

Perfect case Thule!!  Thanx.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only about 20 miles on this new pack but thrilled so far! This was a replacement for my 20-year-old pack. I was embarrassed to send in my old pack for repair and, surprisingly, Osprey sent me a replacement. So grateful for their policy and standing behind my original purchase so long ago. Really enjoying some of the improvements of the feature set of the new Atmos. One negative point - I am struggling to zip the pouches on the hip belt while wearing the pack. Should work easily one-handed but it does not work well. Encountered another backpacker with the same model that said he was having the same problem. His pack and mine were both brand new. Hoping it improves with use and break-in. Really pumped on the pack overall. Super comfortable even when overloaded (wanted to be < 30 lbs but carried 38 lbs when full on Day 1).
review.name: Only about 20 miles on

review.reviewBody: This back is way too big. The waist straps are too big and don't tighten enough. I am 5.8 and weigh 150 pounds. I went on a trip and came back bleeding from my hip bones.
review.name: Do not buy this pack unless you try it on first. It's way too big

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The atmos ag 50/65 is THE BEST backpacking pack out there hands down. I personally use the 50 L and it is the perfect size for 1-3 night trips. It is extremely comfortable with around 30lbs of gear. I love the sleeping bag pocket on the bottom of the pack, absolute necessity and only a feature on the atmos AG NOT the atmos LT. The removable lid is also a welcome feature when you’re trying to go lightweight.
review.name: The atmos ag 50/65 is

review.reviewBody:
This is one of the most critical pieces of gear from my 2023 Appalachian Trail thru-hike. Before I had picked any of my other gear, I knew my pack would be an Osprey. It didn't take much research to settle on the Atmos 50. This thing is a beast and could handle anything I threw at it or in it during my hike. 

The best feature is the one everybody already knows well: the airspace and ergonomic curvature that perfectly forms to your back. Furthermore, this distributes weight very efficiently, allowing your hips to bear more of the burden and relieve your shoulders. Other features I love include the waist pouches where I stored quick access items like my multi-tool and hand sanitizer, the included rain fly for quick rain protection, and the angular water bottle holders on each side where I had quick and convenient access to my one liter Smartwater bottles. I even made regular use of the two pockets in the brain portion. 

The interior dimensions are sufficient to fit a bear vault of the largest size turned sideways. There are straps on the bottom end of the pack that frequently held my tent, though you could also extend the top straps for the brain and store your tent under there too. The shoulder straps are thick and comfortable. I was able to attach a phone pouch on one and regularly attached my umbrella to the other.

The materials are rugged. Despite all the use and abuse, scraping on trees and rocks, repetitive motion abrasion, weather exposure, and slinging around, the pack held up well without failure for 2,000 miles. 

There are probably adjustments I could have made to reduce weight, as this comes in at 4.2 lb. This while most thru-hiking packs in the ultralight category are less than half of that. With Osprey you're getting two extra pounds of comfort, in a sense. Alternatively, they do have the Exos 58 that weighs less. Also, regarding sizing, I think osprey could improve by separating them out into four: S, M, L, and XL. Other lesser known UL brands do this, so I would think osprey could handle it. This is my only real "complaint". All around, Osprey is, in my book, the best backpack maker in existence.
review.name: One of the Best

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this pack. It's the most comfortable I've used, but it's quite heavy. You trade weight for overall comfort when loaded up. If the majority of your kit is relatively light I would highly recommend this pack.
review.name: Incredible pack minus the weight

name: Atmos AG 50L Backpack
Atmos AG 50L Backpack

review.name: the flexibility of the hat itself, is great

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the ability to form the rim to what I need when I’m wearing it in addition to the style. Love love love this hat! I bought two in different colors.
review.name: The Best Ever!

review.reviewBody: We live at the beach and these hats are teh first things we grab heading outside.
review.name: Stylish Sun Protection

review.reviewBody: Super comfy. Super sweat-wicky. Super bendy to give it any style ya likey. And when it's on sale the price is super nicey!
review.name: LOVEY.

review.reviewBody: I really like this hat.  It protects my face from the sun but does it in style.  I bought a medium only because I couldn't locate any vendors offering it in a size small.  That's why I gave it 4 stars, not 5.
review.name: Great lookin' hat.

review.reviewBody: Love this hat! Tiny head, 21.5 and it’s a tic bigger than I need but I get headaches easily when wearing hats and this hat doesn’t hurt my head even after hours of wearing it. I can pull it forward when gardening to better shield my face but also can push it back and see well to drive tractor or 4-wheel. Chin strap keeps it secure when really flying around the property and it doesn’t look dorky but actually is really attractive. I can shape and reshape the brim which Is amazing. Looks great with overalls and mud boots, goes to the hardware store the barn, chicken coop and the fair. Honestly I want one at every door and one for the car! Thankfully this company has tons of styles to choose from so I will be getting more and soon!
review.name: My new favorite hat!

review.reviewBody: I haven’t got a chance to wear the hat much yet, it is really cute. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars is because it runs a little big for a medium. I read this in the reviews, but I took my chance! I’m glad it has a drawstring.
review.name: Cute hat

review.reviewBody: Love it!  Just what I wanted!  The hat fit perfectly!
review.name: Great hat!!

review.reviewBody: I love this summer hat. The color, touch, and feel. It goes with EVERYTHING I wear. Jeans and a western shirt, or the Sundance light blue denim dress with purple embroidery and my green leather sling bag. Stunning!!!
review.name: Live in it

description: Buy the WTB Deva Titanium Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Deva Titanium Saddle
hasVariant.description: Buy the WTB Deva Titanium Saddle online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
It's not a women's saddle, it's not a mtb saddle, it's a saddle that is flat across the back.
I went through about 4 of the Devo version before they where discontinued and spent several years trying SMP, Fabric, FiziK, and a WTB Volt before trying the Deva because it is marketed to women. Most of them now collect dust in a cabinet. I've now spent over 2 years with the Deva and the only difference is the cover is now a more durable microfiber and the price is lower. It is shorter than my other saddles, but after a few rides you don't notice that.
Read Steve Hogg all about SMP where he introduces the concept of effective width (google is your friend). I put a ruler across the saddle and measured width where it rolled off .25 inches. Compared to a SMP dynamic the total width is about 3mm more, but the effective width increases by over an inch across the the back. The difference disappears through the transition to the nose. And it's not just the width of your sit bones. I have an expensive carbon railed saddle that looks out of place on my 1988 Stumpjumper that works fine with the higher and shorter reach I use to ride with grandkids, but not when I rotate my hips forward on a race bike.
Highly recommended.
review.name: Effective Width!

review.reviewBody: I have this on my Enduro bike and it is a huge improvement over my previous saddle (sdg components radar mtn ti-alloy)!
review.name: Huge Improvement

Buy the Fjallraven Kajka 75L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Kajka 75L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Kajka 75L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I recently did a four day trip carrying ~42lbs of gear with this pack. That included ~12lbs of camera equipment and a large 11L bear can. This pack held and carried all that really well. Once the harness and hip belt are dialed in right this pack is quite comfy even with a lot of weight in it. All the zippered pocket (side, hip, internal, bottom) makes organization really easy. I could stuff all my warm wearables in one side zipper pocket and all my rain gear in the other. The front zipper access meant I could get to camera gear stored in a camera gear cube without unpacking everything. This pack is also really robust and puts up with the punishment of the backcountry better several other packs I've used. I've been searching for a good "photography backpacking" bag for a long time and this pack really hits a lot of critical features (despite the obvious weight penalty).
review.name: Great Heavy Hauler

name: Kajka 75L Backpack

description: Buy the HOKA Tennine GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tennine GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the HOKA Tennine GTX Hiking Boot - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My rating was a three star because these were sooo comfortable. However, I couldn't live with the hubble heel that sticks out a couple of inches in the back. My husband called them clown shoes. I love Hoka and their shoes, but not this one.
review.name: Couldn't get past the huge Hubble heel

review.reviewBody: This shoe makes you feel stable on ice when you are walking. My feet don't hurt when I am on them for long periods of time. I love this product.
review.name: Yes

review.reviewBody: I didn't have to break these boots in at all! They were very comfortable the first time out! They're very different looking, but the extended sole gave me a lot of support while hiking.I highly recommend these hiking boots!!!
review.name: My new favorite hiking shoe!!

review.reviewBody: I can be in this pair all day, and never feel like I walked miles and miles; no feet ache and the feet are always at great temperature. You can stride perfectly on any terrain. The bounciness has an amazing feel!
review.name: Best Hoka Product Yet!

review.reviewBody: It feels greats walking at work all day. No knee pain, or foot pain
review.name: I would recommend this product again and again

review.reviewBody: This was an extremely comfortable shoe, and slightly more comfortable than the Kaha GTX I purchased at the same time. However, I felt uncomfortable about the back fins on these shoes, worried about tripping and such, but more importantly, I realized that my Katoola ice cleats would not fit around them, eliminating the possibility of winter hiking, so I returned them.
review.name: Nice shoe but not for me

review.reviewBody: I use these hiking boots to hike 2 to 4 miles of hilly terrain three or four times a week. Before using them I wore Hoka Bondi 7s but wanted some thing for the winter and something that supported my ankles bit better. These strange looking hiking boots fulfill both of those requirements and feel almost exactly like my Bondi7s.
review.name: They are strange looking but I love the way they feel!

review.reviewBody: Our feet support our body. As a healthcare worker, comfort is important. There are various styles to choose from so there is no compromise on style. In our Medical Facility my co-workers are turning to HOKA.
review.name: Fabulous Feet Style and Comfort

review.reviewBody: This is the first boot I ever had that was just as comfortable as gym shoe. It fits exactly like the Bondi 7. But it is waterproof-gore Tex. Perfect for snow, slush, ice and mud.
review.name: The best boot!

review.reviewBody: I took these out for the first hike a week ago, and I'm super happy with the comfort and stability! The design might seem a little bizarre, but let me say... it made a big difference in regards to my footing etc. I'm very happy with my purchase.
review.name: Love!

name: Tennine GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I have tried about a dozen top brands and the Castelli Premium Black Bibshort is thee most comfortable.  On my 2+ hour ride last evening I continue to marvel at the saddle comfort--felt like I ride forever.

A bit snug but that is one reason that the comfort level is so high.
review.name: Most comfortable bibs I own

review.reviewBody: I thought they seemed a bit tight at first (I got large and I'm 6'2" 185 lbs) but after using them a few times now I'm really impressed. I think my old bibs may have been too loose and this is how it's SUPPOSED to be. I have less groin numbness and less rubbing/chaffing I think because everything is held nicely in place. Very comfortable. I will absolutely consider other bike apparel from Castelli and will strongly consider another pair if I ramp up my cycling this summer.
review.name: Tight but just right

review.reviewBody: These are probably the most comfortable bib shorts I have owned. In the winter I do a lot of indoor trainer riding and with minimal moving around tends to make things start to get uncomfortable on longer 90+ mins rides. These really make those ride more tolerable. I haven't ridden outside with them but based on my experience with riding inside, I expect them to be very comfortable for out rides.
review.name: Great bib shorts

review.reviewBody: After a year of 1-2 uses per week, the threads will become loose. This is unacceptable for a product of this price. Castelli warranty will tell you to use scissors. Stick to Rapha and Assos, they have very good warranty support.
review.name: Bad Quality and bad warranty

review.reviewBody: After a year of 1-2 uses per week, the threads will become loose. This is unacceptable for a product of this price. Castelli warranty will tell you to use scissors. Stick to Rapha and Assos, they have very good warranty support.
review.name: Bad quality, thread will become loose.

review.reviewBody:
I've had many different bibshorts over the years, including from brands like Pearl Izumi, Castelli, Giordana, Assos, Descente (remember them?), Mavic, etc.  I've been an Assos adherent since the orange EI inserts.  Unfortunately, I don't think Assos has met those lofty heights since them.  Don't get me wrong, they're still good -- and I currently have a pair of the Equipe RS S9 as well as the Cento Evo -- but I feel that the days of Assos being head and shoulders over the rest may be gone.

Conversely, I was always just a bit disappointed with Castelli.  The original bodypaint bibs were ok, but fell apart relatively quickly.  A prior version of the Free Aero was comically small and tight in the legs.  And the sizing was all over the place, apparently depending on whatever factory Castelli had decided it would subcontract its wares to for that particular item.  I currently have a pair of Free Aero 4, and while some things are very good (overall fit, compression, leg grippers, quality of the short materials) others leave me underwhelmed (bib straps, apparent durability of chamois).  

These Premio bibs, however, tick all the boxes so far.  The fit is fantastic -- snug, compressive, comfortable.  The woven material feels great against the skin and appears to draw moisture (ahem, sweat) from the skin to the surface of the bibs.  The straps are comfortable and lay flat (and seem to be the right size for the bibs!).  The leg grippers are fantastic -- pretty much invisible from the outside, grippier than most grippers on any bibs I've tried, barring the current Free Aero 4 -- and don't pinch your legs at all.  The laser-etched graphics look great, subtle and should be durable.

The chamois is a version of the same Progetto X2 Air as in the Free Aero 4.  But(!) Castelli seems to have addressed one of my concerns with the version in the Free Aero 4, by stitching it to the shorts all the way around in the Premio.  (The Free Aero 4 was open at the "V" notch cutout in the back of the chamois -- in my experience, the exposed foam and padding would delaminate, starting from that opening.  Hopefully, stitching the pad all the way around will increase durability.)  I do note that the chamois in these Premio bibs seems a bit firmer and stiffer than in the Free Aero, so maybe there are other changes as well.  I find the chamois quite good, but a bit stiff feeling, and it could really use a bit more front coverage, like the Assos chamois.  

Overall, these have become the first bibs I grab for longer, or special rides.

UPDATE -- So, I wore these shorts for a century about a month ago (remember, these are my go-to for longer, or special rides).  About 25 miles in, I crashed, going about 18-19mph, according to my Strava data.  I hit the asphalt on my left side, with pretty big bruising and road rash on my knee, shoulder, and hip.  My Q36.5 jersey got a big hole in the shoulder; my Assos glove got a big hole in the palm; even my Sidi shoes got scratched up some on the left Tecno buckle and upper/sole interface.  Amazingly, despite big bruising and road rash on my hip, these shorts remained completely intact.  The only sign of the crash is the fabric has just the faintest abrasion lightening on my left hip.  While I hope not to have to test it again (knock on wood), it seems the woven lycra fabric Castelli uses is quite durable.
review.name: I love the fit and feel of these bibs.

review.reviewBody:
So this is a really good bibshort.  Probably the best I have.  Compression is on point, cut is good, and the chamois is also very comfortable.  The look is understated and will go with every jersey.  The straps initially seem a bit short (and tight), but I didn't really notice them once I was on the bike.  Heat management seems moderate.  They weren't especially cool or breathable.  Not bad, just not "next level" good.

Overall, they're great, but there's nothing so amazing about them that they're worth $100 more than my next nicest pair of bibs.  Or at least not yet.  Two hours is my longest ride in them so far, so maybe they'll shine with more time in the saddle.

I was a little concerned with Castelli sizing, but medium is a great fit for me (I usually wear medium in most brands).

Update - 5 hours on gravel and they were great.
review.name: A really good short - not sure on value
comment: Super light fabric and high quality feel, but they run extremely small&comically small really. I'm 6'0 155lbs and with pedal mafia, rapha, maap etc., a small is typically perfect. The small was nice and snug on the legs and hips, but the straps were literally half the length of my torso. Even though the elastic is very supple and could stretch over my shoulders, they were way too tight to wear for more than a minute or two; even tucked into an aero ride position. I would recommend sizing up one or two sizes.

name: Premio Black Bibshort - Men's

review.reviewBody: Light weight, compact but not down which can wet out above freezing.
review.name: Perfect layer for temperate weather (above freezing).

review.reviewBody: Me 5'-8" 165lb ordered a size medium. I ultimately wanted a Patagonia Nano Puff, but I can't justify the price. I own a pull over Nano puff, and this is what I'm comparing it to. This is an ok substitute. The material is a little more of a trash bag consistency compared to a nano puff and doesn't feel like it regulates temperature quit as well. The fit is a little tight for me in the upper arms with anything other than a thin base layer. Arm length and waist are good. If you are thin and usual fit a medium this should work fine. If you are on the larger size of medium, I wouldn't recommend it.
review.name: A little tight in the arms

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, nice Navy blue color and great fit. My only down side is the zipper is a bit stiff to engage. This is not the warmest but since I don't get cold easily it will be perfect for layering with a gore-tex shell.
review.name: Great jacket, stiff zipper

review.reviewBody: This a great lightweight puffy jacket.  I travel quite a bit and it’s my go to for cooler climates.  It keeps me warm but doesn’t overheat me, easy to pack and looks great.  Durable enough for light outdoor activities and also looks good as a casual going out warming layer.
review.name: Great light weight jacket

review.reviewBody: Taken it fishing on the rogue river in OR and hunting in northern Arizona so far. 16-44 degrees Fahrenheit for both trips. Was able to roll it up into the hoodie part and throw it in my pocket. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody: Glorious color! Nice light Winter Jacket. Comfortable. Well-designed spacious hood. Thank you!
review.name: Beautiful Jacket.

review.reviewBody: Got 2 small tears in it the first time I took it out, slightly overgrown trail with branches grabbing at the arms. Not durable at all, so plan on using it as an around town piece if you purchase, which I recommend you don't.
review.name: 2 Tears on the first outing

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit and lightness both for active urban lifestyle and outdoor activities in natural settings.
review.name: Perfect fit with lifestyle !

review.reviewBody: Pretty decent jacket. Isn't quite as light as i hoped for, but it's very packable. Keeps me fairly warm down to around 40 with just a tshirt underneath. Love the unique color. Fit is kind of weird, but I feel that way with most OR clothes. I'm 6-2 190 fwiw.
review.name: Decent daily driver

review.reviewBody: This is single handedly best puffy jacket I’ve gotten. Long sleeves too which are so nice.

review.reviewBody: After trying my first pair of Danner boots, I decided to try these chukkas. I love the comfortable insoles and there is a fair amount of arch support compared to most shoes. The fit is true to size, I got my usual size 7. The toe box feels comfortably and roomy without being clunky. My toe nails stick up and I often feel pain and pressure from tops of most shoes, however the leather on these is supple and I can tell I won't have that issue with them. The simple lacing means they're quick and easy to put on and tie up, while adding a firm fit around the middle of the foot. I look forward to breaking these and wearing them all around!
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: I sized up because I want to wear thicker socks underneath. They fit great! The leather is soft and looks very high quality. The rubber sole is light-weight and has good grip. Stylish and very versatile!
review.name: great quality

review.reviewBody: I have had so many complaints on these shoes! They are perfect for fall and perfect for dressing up and down! Love them!!
review.name: Sooo cute!!

review.reviewBody: I have several R1 Pategonia Tech Face jackets.  They are great for spring weather and the added hood really keeps you warm when the weather gets colder.  I am super happy with my purchase.  If you are looking for the warmer version of this jacket get the R2 Tech Face with the hood.  Several of the ski patrollers I work with use it under their patrol vest and it keeps them warm.
review.name: R1 Tech Face jacket with hood

review.reviewBody: ROTC program here that consistently rappels with cadets. We ended up returning these due a number of reasons, but the two specific ones were: 1) if you’re a leftie, the rope will twist the lock open when you’re descending, I almost had a cadet fall. 2) they are NOT good quality, and we ended up ordering new ones due to how hot these gets with persistent friction. Get something else
review.name: Lefties beware

description: Buy the Salomon Cross 2-In-1 Short - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cross 2-In-1 Short - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Cross 2-In-1 Short - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: work great for in the gym esp on leg days. simple colors.
review.name: comfy

review.reviewBody: This is my first pair of Salomon shorts.  The waistband is super comfy and doesn’t dig in.  I like they are lightweight.  They do not have a tight compression type fit.  The inner short did ride up a little but not to the point of being annoying.  I didn’t like the way my phone felt in the side pocket, it didn’t feel very secure and pulled the shorts down a bit.  Note I do have a smaller iPhone.  This is not a huge drawback for me since I can also put my phone in my running vest/pack.  I think it would be fine for hiking or walking.  Overall I am satisfied with the fit and comfort.  I will probably also purchase a black pair.
review.name: Great Running shorts
comment: Hello, I appreciate you sharing your ideas with us. We constantly work to get better! Please keep in mind that your suggestions are being taken into consideration!

review.reviewBody: These are really small in size meaning they aren’t as flowy as you’d hope. Definitely size up!
review.name: Size up
comment: Thank you very much for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are constantly striving to improve and innovate with our models, and feedback such as yours is essential to helping us acheive this objective. Your review will be passed to our quality department immediately.

review.reviewBody: I love those shorts! They are great for trail running and hiking. Very comfortable, you hardly know you have them on so much they feel like a second skin! I only wish there were more colours to play with .
review.name: Best shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are extremely comfortable for running or hiking. The spandex was not as tight as I was expecting and my phone bounced a bit while running. I will definitely be wearing these shorts for hiking or shorter runs when I don’t bring my phone. For reference I am 5’3” 125 lbs and bought a size small. It runs a tiny bit on the larger side, but not enough for me to have ordered an XS.
review.name: Soft and comfortable

review.reviewBody: This are light weight. I love the lining underneath. it would be great to have two pockets either side instead of just the one in the shorts. The outer layer doesn't seem to ride up when running. You need to go up a size with these.
review.name: Great Pair of Shorts

review.reviewBody: I got it two weeks ago. I love it. It is comfortable and fast  to dry. The material is soft.
review.name: comfortable

review.reviewBody: Super light, fits really well, and has pockets! Also love the stretchy inner shorts. Will be getting the black one as well.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: First off, I’m not a fan on running shorts because of the fit.  But these were the best ones I’ve found.  I like the stretchy fabric under the shorts - definitely prevented chaffing.  The pocket on the right side under the shorts were perfect for my phone and easy to access through my run using gps on the trail.  I hope they never discontinue this style!
review.name: Light weight

review.reviewBody: I love my shorts! They make me run faster as I do not feel them on, they are super light and breathable!!! I am in between sizes S and M and I ordered S as I didn’t want them to look like a skirt! They fit but M would probably fit too if I wanted it to be slightly longer.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been looking for a Stetson for awhile. Never goes on sale (even around Christmas). Found the one I wanted on Backcountry and I am thrilled with my purchase. Arrived quickly in the original Stetson box.
review.name: Beautiful with Great Price

review.reviewBody: This is my 2nd open road hat…I love the style…the royal deluxe felt is softer than the regular 6x felt…nicely made and the cognac color is beautiful….Backcountry shipped fast and the hat arrived in great shape!
review.name: 2nd open road

review.reviewBody: I own a good handful of Stetsons and finally purchased the Open Road. I loved it so much that I immediately bought a second one. Backcountry regularly offers discounts, they ship fast, and pack well. Might as well order a third.
review.name: Stetson for the win!

review.reviewBody:
I LOVE this hat! The quality is beautiful, it is VERY comfortable and elegant. The cognac is a very rich color. The brim is a perfect size. I may have to get other colors! Thank you Backcountry!  I normally wear a 7 1/8, but ordered a 7 and it is perfect.
Michelle
review.name: Rockin hat!

review.reviewBody:
I purchased the navy Open Road. Classy, and cool! ? The fit was perfect, the color was vibrant.
 I wore it with a two button navy suit, yellow shirt, and black oxfords. Lots of compliments!
Backcountry is my go to, for Stetson hats!
review.name: Great hat! Great fit!

review.reviewBody: This is my first purchase from Back Country. I purchased the Open Road deluxe in Caribou by Stetson. This hat arrived quickly and was in perfect condition. The Caribou color was better in person than in the pictures. I bought this hat because of the 25 percent off price which not even Stetson has on their website. That hat fit perfectly and I will be looking for another one when the color becomes available. Back Country will definitely be getting my business in the future.
review.name: Outstanding Hat!

review.reviewBody: When ordering Stetson hats, even directly from Stetson, I always anticipate finding a small defect; usually in the brim, but this Sage Open Road is flawless.  The color is much more interesting in person, and seems a bit darker in natural lighting than what you see in these well-lit studio photos here.  This will be the closest thing to black I ever buy.  I own many styles of hats, but the Open Road has to be my favorite overall.  So far I've got the cognac in felt, and in straw, and this sage.
review.name: Perfect hat

review.reviewBody: I purchased the Sage color,  Size 7.  All I can say is that it's a really nice hat.  Soft, flexible (not floppy) and extremely comfortable.  The Open Road 6X is the stiffer model of this hat.  I like that one also.  This fairly new Open Road Royal Deluxe hat is more of a dressy, soft fabric hat.  Although one can wear it anywhere, anytime.  My experience with Stetson sizing is that their felt hats seem to run just a tad on the larger size.  For example, this Open Road Royal Deluxe in a size 7 1/8 was too large for me, however the size 7 was somewhat perfect.  If your hat arrives and is a just tad on the larger size or fits slightly loose, just slip a strip or two of regular kitchen paper towel inside the inner sweat band.   You'll figure out how long, short or thickness the paper towel strips should be.  It's the perfect way to get that perfect fit without going a size larger and finding out that 1/8 inch makes a ton of difference in sizing.  I love the color Sage and love this hat.   I wear it all the time.  I have a total of eight Open Road felt hats and six Open Road Straw hats.  Love 'em all.  It's a high quality product, Made in the USA.  Stetson is an icon in American Cowboy history.  Some past Presidents have been  photographed wearing a Stetson Road.
review.name: It's A Really Nice Hat

name: Open Road Royal Deluxe Hat

description: Buy the BioLite Charge 20 PD Powerbank online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Charge 20 PD Powerbank
hasVariant.description: Buy the BioLite Charge 20 PD Powerbank online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My gf won it as a corporate gift and I how compact it is and it came with a usb c cord. Good grip and light. I added my sticker to personalize it.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: Very handy on recent camping trip when main source of power ran out. This ran out lights at night and charged my phone
review.name: Great for hiking and camping

review.reviewBody: I‘ve got the 20 and the 80 version. Loading my iPhone13 with 1,4A by USB and 1.8A by USB C. Capacity like in the manufactors description. Charge 20 for 1 to 1.5 times and Charge 80 for several loadings. Design and quality of the battery is quite well. The Charge 20 is a lightweight for the pocket, Charge 80 more heavier powercharge for seversl days. Best battery I own an absolutely recommended if you need powersupply!
review.name: Recommended!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic due to its weight and dependability. We own many 40 and 80 models, too, which are equally the best on the market!
review.name: The 20, 40, and 80 models are best-in-class!

review.reviewBody: This is the third one I bought, this one was for my sister and she loved it.
review.name: Great Back Up

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Charge 20 PD with the Flexlight for its portability and brightness.  I am also using it for the times I need carry something light to recharge my phone.  I use the light/charger for doing needlecraft, reading light, and on my music stand to play at night.
review.name: Lightweight Charger

review.reviewBody: Small long lasting and quick recharge. Delivery was very fast.
review.name: Charge 20 PD

review.reviewBody: I was so surprised by its size and easy portability. A great energy source.
review.name: Small But Mighty

review.reviewBody: Have had several of the older BioLite battery packs and love them ! Was excited for these new ones which supported USC C charging (because almost everyone these days has the new Apple lightening cable), as well as supporting the charging of multiple devices. Unfortunately, in order to re-charge the battery pack you need the specific USB A to USC C cable included with the battery pack. Most other battery packs (such as the older BioLite ones), as well as battery lanterns use a micro charger. Almost everyone in the world has a micro charger for charging various battery items. This battery pack will require you to carry around another cable or add another cable to your home charging station just to charge this device. Unfortunately, I didn't read closely enough that the charging INPUT was USB-C. Knocking off one star. If the input for re-charging the battery pack would have been a micro charger, it would have been perfect.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: I just started to use my new battery storage device and it worked great the first time (which is so far). I am currently using it for day hikes when I am using a smart phone for its apps, and also a camera. First use: before leaving, I charged the extra battery. Over the day, my phone charge fell to about 65% (and I barely used the camera). In the car instead of plugging the phone into the car's charger, I used the Biolite battery. Over the ~2 hr drive home, it fully charged. Having this unit makes me feel more secure in case of mishaps on my hikes. I imagine the phone's re-charging was slower than a wall power source, but it met my needs and exceeded my expectations. On an off-the-grid trip, I imagine sunny weather would allow producing charge on my little Biolite panel, perhaps even while transferring it to this storage form. The battery can charge my phone, headlight and camera. I like how the various Biolite units can work together for day-trips or when away from the grid longer.
review.name: Handy portable battery storage

name: Charge 20 PD Powerbank

It offers so much adjustment it really is the best shoe I have ever worn. Competitive Cyclist returns were very easy and customer service was helpful.
review.name: Sizing was a bit tricky for my feet.

review.name: 20 degrees is best for all around

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I brought this sleeping bag with me on my thru-hike of the Pacific Crest Trail last summer. I slept in it for 150 nights and never let me down! Great balance between weight, warmth, and price. However, I found it very narrow. I like to sleep with my legs forming a figure 4 shape, but it was impossible to do in this bag. I also rotate like a rotisserie chicken during the night and I got tangled in it a few times. A little bit cold when temperatures drop towards 0°C, especially when the bottom of the bag is exposed, as it is less insulated than the top. I had to wear my puffy for those nights or wrap it around my bum to keep it warm. Finally, I found it a bit bulky but it is overall a great product! I would recommend it to thru-hikers on a budget or anyone going on shorter trips.
review.name: Travelled 2600 miles and it never let me down

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good year round sleeping bag. Warm and soft.  Nice color.
review.name: Sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought the Trestles Elite 20 because of the packability and the COMFORT rating of -6.5C.   I have yet to have a sleep sufficiently warm enough even around 4-5 celsius, which is the lowest I have used this bad. I am not a cold person in general, but with this bag I have to wear multiple sets of thermals, multiple socks, and I have even resorted to taking a hot water bottle to bed to try and stay warm. I have had to now return to using my Asolo and Coleman bags, which are surprisingly much more warm, and only slightly larger/heavier. I really wanted this bag to work but it doesn't perform as marketed, and I am really disappointed in this Marmot product.
review.name: Temperature rating not accurate
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via Contact Us | Marmot or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The sleeping bag has been great for both backpacking and car camping. Held up (just) in below freezing temperatures and does well for warmer temperatures. Light, cozy, packs pretty small. Easily fits back in it's stuff sack. We like how the women's had a choice of zip side. Needed a synthetic sleeping bag as my partner is vegan and we're happy with the purchase :) reasonably priced too. Good size for us (160-175 cm), although a little snug across the bag
review.name: A nice little eco sleeping bag

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] OMG sooo warm, soft and fluffy. I was able to pack it down pretty small in a stuff sack. Every night while I was backpacking, I looked forward to getting into this sleeping bag.
review.name: Cozy and warm - great purchase!

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great quality as usual!  Love the build compared to cheaper sleeping bags I bought in the past.
review.name: Great Marmot quality for sure

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Kept me warm on some pretty cold nights in Paragonia. I'm exactly 165 cm and have wide hips - it fits me great. I found the strings on the hood a bit tricky the first time I tried to tighten the hood (was the middle of the night though and I was sleepy). 
Best feature I've discovered so far is that it's water repellent - my friend's dog peed on the sleeping bag. I rinsed the area out with a hose for half a minute and in no time the sleeping bag was dry and with no trace of dog-pee smell or anything.
review.name: Comfy and warm.

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for my wife and as a back-up bag for when I take friends camping. I got a long so it was basically the same size as the men’s regular. I have the men’s Trestles 15 regular and I will say while this one is more money and lighter weight, the cheaper, slightly heavier 15 is way more comfortable. You can tell this one just isn’t as soft and comfortable. Idk why, maybe it’s the eco material. Other than that, it’s an excellent bag.
review.name: Great bag but not as soft as the Trestles 15

review.itemreviewed: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Only taken out for 1 camping trip since I bought this, but it was the most comfy sleep I've had in years. The fact that it's eco friendlier than most options really helped made my choice, more then other technical features. I was afraid it might be to cold. Not at all. It packs up alright, on the bigger side. I'd say perfect for car camping, decent for hiking trips!

And it's eco friendly. If there's any doubt, that should help right? Any little change you can make will help!
review.name: Snug like a bug!

name: Trestles Elite Eco 20 Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic - Women's

review.reviewBody: This thing works fast & efficient even in 9° weather.. I have purchased 2 as gifts. Super useful if you ride enduro, hunt, or hike. I think my next purchase with be the FluxRing Cook Pot & the pot support.
review.name: Great Purchase

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a way to prepare my meals quickly and with minimal cleanup. This has surpassed my expectations.
review.name: Fast and portable

review.reviewBody: I carry mine whether hiking, hunting, or snowmobiling. Being able to have a warm meal on below freezing days is great and this heats up rapidly. I also work with the Search and Rescue in my hometown. I carry one in my EMT kit in order to provide warm fluids and foods to people we go out and find.
Perfect for fast boiling water in the field at drill and while camping
I take it everywhere for coffee, dried foods, etc.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: Have used 5 times, water is boiling within 3-5 minutes. Perfect for 2 people making coffee/foods. My guess is it makes almost 16oz/serving. Have used in 40°F - 85°F temps. Great, durable material. Would only use water for easy cleaning when camping or on the go.
Works great and heats water and food quickly. Easy to light. Unfortunately a mild wind can put out the flame. To fix this I took a piece of foil and made a wind break.
review.name: Works Great

review.reviewBody: I held off on getting one of these for the longest time. I thought, I’ve got a pot, why do I need a jet boil. This boils water wicked fast! When you’re hunting, it’s cold and you want hot food and drink, 3-5 mins makes a big difference. The fit of the burner could be a little better. But over all, a good investment for making coffee and freeze dried meals in the field.
review.name: Very Fast

review.reviewBody: I keep it in my patrol car, and it comes in handy for brewing coffee on a dive site. I plan to get another to store in my motorcycle for off-roading, maybe another in a go bag.

I’ve taken this out with me on field training exercises, up mountains and all over the place. It’s lightweight, sturdy, and has a large enough capacity to heat up enough water to warm up a peak trail meal and still have enough for a cup of coffee afterwards.
The Jetboil is a lifesaver when you are cold and decaffeinated. It’s super easy to use and packs up nicely into itself. 10/10 would recommend.

name: Flash Stove

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this liner with my StS Trek bag on a double-circuit teahouse trek in Nepal. Teahouse rooms are unheated, and many are over 12,000'. This warm, stretchy and comfortable liner helped keep my bag clean and me warm, the very few times I needed it for warmth.

Only 4 stars, because:
My StS bag has a separate zipper for the footbox, that I usually have open, even at high elevations and thought the liner would, too. I thought this because the pictures online (& even the one StS attached to the email asking for this review), plus wording on the box state the bottom has a drawstring. It doesn't for the semi-rectangular version I needed. So, my dear spouse ripped the bottom open and sewed one in.

StS did apologize for the incorrect wording on the package, and made it as right as they could.
review.name: Great liner. Slight misrepresentation on the package.

review.reviewBody: I've purchased the older version that's the super warm ones for fall camping in Colorado and it was super warm but a little bit challenging for me as I like to poke my feet out of the sleeping bag when I run hot. This design is superb with the option to cinch the feet and the snap buttons on top, really made it much user friendly for someone like me. This material is cooling, perfect for the upcoming summer camping. Super soft material, made it very easy to sleep in. Totally would recommend!
review.name: Love the new updates to the bag liners!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] for the hot summer months and for those cold nights that you need something else. 
i mainly use this to cool down my body when it gets too warm but need that extra layer just to stay cool, in the summer this works well with a light blanket. and for the winter i use it to keep my quilt clean but still keep myself cool if it gets too hot, it adds extra layer of warmth because of all the heat being trapped and it is very cozy for sure i love this and planning to buy more.
review.name: Like a Bed Sheet but in the outdoors!

review.reviewBody:
First of all, you NEED a liner for your sleeping bag. If you wash your bedding at home once a week—that being under ideal hygienic conditions where you shower every single day—you really don't want that funk getting into your expensive sleeping bag! That's where a liner really helps!

This liner is an upgrade for me. I've been using a Sea-to-Summit Comfort Blend for several years, and I've really liked that product a lot. But I thought a back-up liner might be nice. But I was really blown away with how nice the Breeze liner is! Mine is the regular Mummy style, and I really appreciate the soft, wicking material that the Breeze is constructed from. Apparently it's a similar material as the Tek towels (I think…maybe its one of the other towels?). I sleep hot, and I sweat a lot at night, so drawing that moisture off is a really nice feature. To help regulate my comfort (including at home) I usually stick my feet out of the end of the bed (and of the liner), so the opening at the bottom is actually a really welcome feature! Yeah…I don't wander the campsite in my liner, but I suppose you could if you wanted to. To each their own!

Anyhow, I really love my new liner. What WAS going to be a spare is now my go-to!
review.name: You NEED a liner as nice as this!

review.reviewBody: I don't normally give five stars, but I really like this product. I have the mummy version and love the drawstring bottom and snaps at the top. The snaps at the top mean you can have your arms free which is great for people who sleep with their hands behind or above their head. It is so easy to wash compared to a sleeping bag. I also have a Reactor liner and the Breeze liner is noticeably cooler to the touch. This is a great product for camping on warm summer nights!
review.name: Amazing product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag liner is genius. I never knew sleeping bag liners were a thing until we got this product. It's so easy to wash and will keep the sleeping bag clean. I never wanted to wash our sleeping bags because it's such a pain.  I love how lightweight it is. I'm a hot sleeper plus I live in Texas, so this liner will honestly be enough even without the sleeping bag most of the time. I also love the idea of being able to use it in hotels or in travel situations if I'm concerned about cleanliness. It's easy to pack and takes up almost no space. I'm so happy to have this liner.
review.name: Genius Product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is very soft, I haven’t been able to use it since it’s still too cold in Oregon to go camping but I love the material, definitely going to be great to have the coolmax moisture whicking this summer when it’s hot!
review.name: Great liner for summer camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was happy to test out the Sea to Summit Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner complimentary through Influenster in exchange for my honest review. I had never thought of using a liner before being introduced to this product, but this is actually quite useful. As someone who tends to get hot quite easily, especially while sleeping, this felt great on the skin. As soon as you envelope yourself in this liner, you get a nice cooling effect. The material is soft, lightweight and allows for movement, which adds to a comfortable sleep. This liner is shaped nicely with a hood, arm holes and an open bottom, so you could just wear this out and pull up the bottom if you need to get out of your sleeping bag in the middle of the night, and therefore, not leave this to get tangled in the bottom of the bag or struggle to get comfortably around you. I did notice the cooling sensation wear off while I slept, but I did not wake up drenched in sweat or feel like I was overheating as I often do.  I hand washed this in cold and hung it to dry and it was dry within the day. I believe with proper care this will hold up nicely as long as you do not snag it. Also, this comes with a travel pouch and takes up very little space and would be easy to travel with. I'm very pleased with this product and find it to be a useful solution to hot sleepers like myself.
review.name: Cooling Sensation

name: Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner

review.reviewBody: I was hoping this was softer, like fleece, but it’s just medium weight and not very plush.  It also runs a bit small, so I’m glad I followed my instincts to get a large instead of medium which I usually wear!  Even the large was a bit tight. I’m 5’4” and 133 lbs.  I would recommend sizing up!
review.name: Cute, but tight

review.reviewBody:
Many months ago, I bought a blue one that I really liked. It's keeping me warm, it's not bulky and it fits me well. I have worn it and washed it a lot and it is still great looking. I bought two more, but of the new ones that I received, one had the elastics at the wrists completely stretched, to the point where I can't roll my sleeves up and a lot of cold air gets in. I will have to have it repaired. While they are all medium sizes, there is a noticeable difference beetween the sleeves widths. The seams were also not well finished on the second one I received.

I would have given 5 stars to the blue one I first got, but it seems the quality is not constant...
review.name: Inconstant quality

review.reviewBody: I have this in two colors. Just the right weight. Can be worn on chilly days with just a tshirt or on colder days layer up. Not too heavy to wear under a jacket. I found it true to size except the sleeves are excessively long. I ended up having the sleeves shortened.
review.name: Love kavu fleece

review.reviewBody: I got this top in my regular size large, but it is tiiiight. I would size up for a more relaxed, comfortable fit.
review.name: comfy, but size up

review.reviewBody:
I have three of these same Kavu fleeces in three different colors - two from last season and I just ordered the black color from this season. The two I already own have gone through the wringer. I wear them from early fall through the spring here in CT, USA. I love the zippered kangaroo pocket and they’re easy to wash - I use a gentle cycle on “eco-warm”, vinegar in place of fabric softener (so bad for your clothes!!), and air dry. They both look brand new still.

The only issue is that I think the sleeves should be longer. I have kind of long arms though but they’re definitely shorter on my arms than I like. Otherwise, these are a great option!
review.name: Absolutely adore this fleece!

review.reviewBody: I purchased the shadow inlay. The fit is true to size. It is soft, comfortable and warm. I have worn it for cross country skiing under a light down jacket.  It is very warm and does not restrict movement.
review.name: Warm and cozy fleece

review.reviewBody: Very soft, good details, love the colors! I wear a medium but got a Large and its so comfy!
review.name: Love the Kavu style!

name: Cavanaugh Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Fit well, dry quickly, comfortable indoors and out.
review.name: Well made and versatile

review.reviewBody: PA ks down to the size of a soda can but provides big warmth in cooler temperatures. It's a must for airplanes and autumn back pack trips.
review.name: Comes in handy In a pinch.

review.reviewBody: Running Errands, Trails, Snowboarding, or just daily use, this thing has quickly become my Go-To Favorite.  I always get compliments when wearing this & Love how comfortable it is while nicely regulating body heat.
review.name: This has quickly become my Go-To Mid-Layer

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm, breathable, and sharp looking too. I've tried a lot of nice fleece and wool pieces. This is one of the very best.
review.name: Awesome sweater

review.reviewBody: Great jacket but the sleeves and general length is oddly too long.
review.name: Too long

review.reviewBody: Great mid layer. versatile for multiple winter sports. Fit is a bit loose.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Comfortable and stylish (till the logo started peeling off a bit at a time). Unfortunately, mine had a defect in the seam on arrival and the logo came off within a few months, also had some pilling.
Functionally similar to R1 or other light fleece.
review.name: style over substance

review.reviewBody: This is my go-to midlayer for ski touring.  Using this with a baselayer has been a game changer for staying comfortable while ski touring -- it's just warm enough, and breathable.

Light well-made layer! Great company too. I am never disappointed with MAMMUT! This runs large just so you know but it is really nice to have a Lightweight fleece for any time of year. I use this around the house, skiing, and while playing disc golf. Love this piece, I wish they had more color options but black goes with everything so it works. I took this to Europe and was super stylish on both sides of the pond! Cheers!
review.name: Awesome Layer

review.reviewBody: Warmth,fit, stretch, breathability! This jacket has it all.  Perfect as a midlayer for warmth and as an outer layer for high exertion activities.

name: Aconcagua Light ML Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the K2 BFC 100 BOA Ski Boot - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BFC 100 BOA Ski Boot - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the K2 BFC 100 BOA Ski Boot - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I hadn't bought new ski boots in over a decade and this boot absolutely has blown me away. I have a very odd-shaped foot (low volume, but wide) and my previous boots I spent hours with an expert boot technician working to punch them and get them comfortable. 

These out of the box fit great, they are very warm, and they have some great simple customization options (toe inserts for my lower volume foot and a calf insert to help with a more aggressive forward stance). I haven't needed to heat them or take them to a fitter. If the BOA system holds up it will be an amazing feature too because it makes is so much faster getting them on an off while skiing with my little kids! always a plus.

Would highly recommend!
review.name: Amazing boot! Great value!

name: BFC 100 BOA Ski Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'0 220 athletic build.  Returned large and got XL after layering was to tight.  Love this jacket
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: To review the fit of this jacket: I'm 5'8, 150, runner build with broad shoulders. I went with small. Length of sleeves and torso are perfect and cant imagine going bigger for my height unless I weighed more. Fits a base layer and puffy fine. Definitely a little tight in the chest when layered though not super restrictive, so not a huge factor for the uphill. Inner mesh pockets aren't quite big enough to casually throw both skins in one, but that's a trade-off for the size of the external hand pockets. Otherwise, quality and durability are great. Removeable powder skirt is clutch. 4.5 stars rounded up to 5.
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: This thing is bombproof. Heavy-duty for when the weather throws everything at you.
review.name: Workhorse

review.reviewBody: Great jacket! 5’10” 190lb in shape male. Used the jacket for backcountry skiing and for hiking. It held up in all the conditions Park City and Whistler had to offer. Held up well against snow, rain and wind. It was a little tight with lots of layers. Helmet does not fit completely under the hood but this was not important to me.
review.name: Exceeded expectations in Utah and Whistler.

review.reviewBody: XL fits big but love the style. Love the Gortex. Truly water proof. Would recommend to a friend.
review.name: Great Cost

review.reviewBody: This jacket rocks. Highly recommend! It’s a nice durable shell that lets me layer how I see fit.
review.name: This jacket rocks!

review.reviewBody: Ordered for ski patrol/ off duty shell. Works well.
review.name: Ski patrol + off duty shell.

review.reviewBody: Fits well. Really like the the powder skirt pant interface.
review.name: Great Jacket

review.reviewBody: Perfect shell for free ride skiing. Roomy fit that works well with layers.
review.name: Really Nice

review.reviewBody: Hands down best shell money can buy. Don’t let people convince you otherwise, this is the best
review.name: Best shell ever

name: Boundary Ridge GORE-TEX 3L Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Not difficult to pull on then snug down via the straps, lightweight yet warm. A 1/2 size up would alleviate a bit snug in the toe fit. Wear daily.
review.name: Daily Ramble

review.reviewBody: Love these. I bought a pair in black and brown. My everyday winder shoe.
review.name: Perfect 'Everyday' Fall / Winter Shoe!
comment: Thanks for the love Todd!

review.reviewBody: maybe i'm just getting old, but oftentimes i don't want to have to lace up my hiking boots for short runs to the grocery store or walks to the mailbox.  these boots are perfect for fall and winter in the mountain town where i live.  they are easy to get in and out of and totally fun to wear.  and because they are chacos, i don't have to guess about the quality.  I chose a larger size than I would normally order, not only to accommodate the lining, but also the orthotic prescribed by p.t.  and if all that isn't enough, i love that they are made of cloth not leather, to fit seamlessly into my plant-based lifestyle.
review.name: new fall and winter favorite

review.reviewBody: love them! Easy and warm,durable.My go to easy chill shoe.
review.name: slip on comfort/chill
comment: Thanks for the great feedback Chris!

review.reviewBody:
This was something I acquired purely as an impulse buy. Knew something of Chaco as I had friends who liked their sandals. Picked this shoe because I liked the overall concept. Also because I overheard people criticizing it's appearance which seemed silly considering what I felt it was made to do. Not every piece of gear needs to be a fashion statement.
Love 'em. Big thumbs up. Comfortable as hell. Durable. Easily slipped in and out of. Great multi-surface traction. Light weight perfect when you're trying to keep pack weight. Great thing to swap to in the field when the boots come off.
Am recommending to everyone.
review.name: Surprise find. Now a favorite piece of footgear.
comment: Thanks for the stellar feedback!

name: Ramble Rugged Shoe - Men's
