hasVariant.name: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: We love that we can flip the rack up if we aren’t using it and how easy that is to do so we can get into the hatch. The rack is amazingly sturdy! The directions to put it together may have tested our relationship a little due to a lack of clarity but overall we have been very happy with the rack!
review.name: Very sturdy and easy to use

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: This bike rack is very easy to use and minimizes the space behind my SUV.
review.name: Great bike rack

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody:
I bought  the Double Tract Pro XT a few weeks ago, as the other one from Thule we had bought a few years ago was too heavy for us to manage. I now see they have put wheels on that model. This one is much lighter and we can easily handle it. 
We had some difficulty in putting it together following the instructions. It took us about 3-3 1/2 hours to finally put it together through trial and error.
review.name: Nice and light

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: Ordered on line and received in a timely manner. Easy to assemble with exact instructions in 30 minutes. Bikes were easy to mount onto the rack and very secure.
review.name: Great double track bike rack.

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: Nous avons le support à vélo il y a un mois. La fonction de descente du support lorsque les vélos sont chargés est géniale!
review.name: Solide et efficace

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: Design issues. Lots of plastic which will surely fail in time. Wheel Supports 1. Are made too high so you can´t open your tailgate unless the rack is completely down with no bikes 2. are not easy to slide and adjust for different bike wheelbase lengths. Latching mechanism buttons have cheap feel to them and despite made to insert key locks, they are not supplied nor can I find locks for those on this website. Therefore, you have to use a cable lock to lock your bikes which is an added nuisance. Also, unfortunately not designed to use a through bolt with lock for hitch nor is one available for sale. This is essential to keep thieves from stealing entire unit from automobile in or not in use.  For the price, I am disappointed in the value of this unit, mostly for design reasons because you would think you could lock the unit and bikes in place. Missed opportunity to provide a great product by Thule.
review.name: Potential was there for a great rack.

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: Nice quality, i feel that my bike it’s safe, I would like that comes with spare straps for the tires
review.name: Good bike rack

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: I purchased this rack because I was transporting 2 bikes frequently.  One of the bikes is a full suspension and didn't have room to slide on to the arm style rack I was using.  This rack allows for some odd shaped frames to be secured.  The trays are big enough for some MTB tires as well.   There is a little more of a build to this rack than other Thule racks I'm aware of, but works well.
review.name: Nice Hitch Rack.

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: I got this for my daughter's birthday. I was surprised by all of the assembly steps,  but she took it home and got it together. Thank goodness for the YouTube videos!
review.name: Excellent quality. Tricky (for us) to assemble

review.itemreviewed: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier
review.reviewBody: It is a Thule.  What else do you need to know?  This assembled faster than I thought it should, the materials are better than my last Thule and that rack was with me 14 years - until I sold it and I guess it is still working somewhere.
review.name: Light, Incredibly Sturdy, Perfectly Designed

name: DoubleTrack Pro XT - 2 Bike Hitch Carrier

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this jacket for ice climbing as my belay jacket and it has performed just as I had hoped. It has nice big dump pockets for switching your gloves out between climbs, and of course the double zipper for belaying comfortably. The face fabric has some durability to it which I like and although it is not waterproof it has a DWR finish that works great at keeping the jacket pretty dry. It is designed well to fit over your harness without having to size up. I am 5' 6" and 170 lbs and I got a medium.
review.name: Confidently warm

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this jacket for ice climbing as my belay jacket and it has performed just as I had hoped. It has nice big dump pockets for switching your gloves out between climbs, and of course the double zipper for belaying comfortably. The face fabric has some durability to it which I like and although it is not waterproof it has a DWR finish that works great at keeping the jacket pretty dry. It is designed well to fit over your harness without having to size up. I am 5' 6" and 170 lbs and I got a medium.
review.name: Confidently warm

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I used this during the Michigan Ice Fest as a belay parka.  At one point, it was well below zero with wind chill, but it kept me comfortable.  It is so comfortable and well fitting that I was even able to climb while wearing it because I just refused to take it off.  I looked like a mushroom in my photos, but I was a warm mushroom.  The pockets are well located and did not interfere with my harness.  The arms had full movement.  The bottom zip was adjustable to fit the harness as well.  The inside pockets hold everything.  Great purchase.  Well worth it.
review.name: Great belay parka

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had a first-gen (possibly only gen) Dri Down puffy from Sierra Designs, and it was a great coat but lacked some features. One of those was a DWR or water-resistant coating. 10 years later, time to replace my old puffy. The Eigeroch pro jacket ticks all the boxes, and it's been field-tested for late-October desert camping in utah. The lows were mid-30s, and I was super comfy with minimal layers. Worth it!
review.name: Best Cold-Weather Camping Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket felt like wearing a cloud made of goose. It was extremely warm, up to -50 C. The large zippers and draws on them were a bonus when getting in and out of pockets in frigid temps.
review.name: Arctic tested

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is incredibly warm and seems like great quality.  Really looking forward to testing it out in some extreme environments.
review.name: Great jacket

review.itemreviewed: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was up at Edora when they shut the resort down due to high winds but inside my jacket I was nice and warm. I like the adjustable hood bc usually hoods cover my face but this helps keep the hood on but not over my eyes. I went ice climbing in it and it held up well. This is saying a lot as I have full body contact in the ice as I climb with one leg. I took it to Michigan and it packed down well for the flights and was able to stuff into the suitcase just fine.
review.name: Very warm

name: Eigerjoch Pro In Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I'm now on my second one of these failing. They start reading bad then just stopped transmitting power data. Beware.
review.name: Second one has failed in a year

review.reviewBody:
I built up a new Tarmac SL7 frameset this summer and wanted a good, accurate PM.  I'm partial to Di2 and Shimano, but I read about accuracy issues with dual sided PM's using the latest Ultegra/Dura-Ace crankset.  
This Quarq PM fit the bill perfectly to pair together with Dura-Ace Di2 and chainrings.  Looks fantastic and provides reliable power numbers.  I'm also loving the MagicZero automatic zero offset that doesn't require you to zero offset before every ride.  Just hop on the bike and start riding.
I'm not a weight weenie but I did compare total weight of PM/crankset/BB to a comparable Shimano based setup.  Weight is within 10-15g.  Price is also competitive with the alternatives.
Very happy with my purchase and 10/10 would buy again.
review.name: Great alternative to Shimano based PM
comment: Is that the newest dub crank arm and dub dfour?  Do you know the total weight?

name: DFour DUB Power Meter Spider

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great looking shoes and not bad value for money. Was a little disappointed in the quality as they don’t feel like they will last long at all which is unusual for Merrell shoes.
review.name: Great looking but not great quality.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Loving these shoes, will definetly purchase more Merrell in the future.
review.name: Awesome fit

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Amazing shoe, fast and light. Excellent grip and strong upper, better than the previous version.
review.name: I love these shoes from the first run.

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had to lace these for a heel lock to get the best fit but after that they were as comfortable as being barefoot. I wore them up the back side of Pikes Peak and I was honestly shocks the traction. The grip on rocks, dirt and kitty litter gravel was mind blowing! I didn’t have any blisters or falls on the descent. I’m very happy with these shoes and they are lightweight too.
review.name: Traction, traction, traction!

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these a few weeks ago and have been thoroughly underwhelmed. 
1. The lack of sole coverage allows rocks to hit the tendons under your arch. Painful. 
2. When the shoes were wet, the insole became bunched up very quickly and I had to rip them out to keep going. Uncomfortable. 
3. The shoes force my ankles to over pronate inward which is not something I’m used to. It was like the shoe is trying to spin around my foot with every step. Awkward. 
4. They did dry quickly and have great grip but I have no confidence in these shoes anymore. 

I'd like to return them.
review.name: Disappointing

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Exceptionally light with low stack but excellent protection underfoot. I have run three trail runs on these since I got them, on fairly technical rocky/rooted single track, for a total of about 35 miles. Each run has been a PR on trails I run regularly… I’d even consider these for a 50k. The upper material doesn’t retain water. My new favorite.
review.name: Wow, what a pleasant surprise!

review.itemreviewed: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: It just arrived, perfect, lightweight, vivid colours , toe box  is roomy!
comment: Thank you for sharing your review.

name: MTL Skyfire 2 Matryx Trail Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Road Turbo Presta Valve Tube With Talc
review.reviewBody: Bought a few of these on sale on Backcountry and I’d say around half of the tubes brand new out of the box and onto the wheels ruptured when inflated to roughly 80psi. Never had this issue with Continental or other brands so it’s extremely disappointing to pay this much for a tube which immediately fails.
review.name: These are terrible and had poor QAQC

review.itemreviewed: Road Turbo Presta Valve Tube With Talc
review.reviewBody: They are expensive but they are the best. I have ran them against continental race light and they are just a little better. You would have to go with a latex tube or go tubeless for any less rolling resistance.  The plastic bag that they come in is perfect for holding a co2 inflator and adapter. Keep your flat repair kit nice and tight for your jersey pocket or like I do and have multiple in your saddle bag
review.name: The best tubes

review.itemreviewed: Road Turbo Presta Valve Tube With Talc
review.reviewBody: It's definitely easier to slip the tube into the tire when the tube is coated in talc. But that's under dry conditions. Not sure if the talc would get mucky if you had to change a tube in the rain.
review.name: Makes fixing flats less of a chore

name: Road Turbo Presta Valve Tube With Talc

description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi 28L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Singi 28L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fjallraven Singi 28L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag about a month ago and I love it. It's become my go-to bag for short and long hikes. Very comfortable and very durable. I go hiking every weekend and even once or twice after work during the week. This pack has quickly become my outdoor sidekick. My one and only complain is the fact the pack does not include load lifters. Luckily, the length is perfect for me. I have a long torso and the hip belt fits just right. If you have a short torso, this may not be the bag for you since you can't adjust this.
review.name: Love this pack!

review.reviewBody: I've had this bag a month an its become my go to for bushcrafting and outdoor use
review.name: Love the daisy chain webbing

review.reviewBody: asking what other countries make a fjallraven bags like singi series? if there was any other country made considered as original made?
review.name: singi 28L

review.reviewBody:
Bought after working out of a north face rucksack (I think it was called that) for a year. I've got mine set up with three pouches; one on each side and one on the center portion covering the elastic cord that's placed there to dry wet stuff.
Behind that pouch I have one or two carabiners attached to the cord. 

This is used for daytrips, 1-2 day overnights in hotels or field stuff with already emplaced tents and cots. So external pouches will hold: jetboil like stove and pot with fuel cannister, 1lt steel bottle of water, and radio equipment and/or chargers mouse, power strip etc.
Inside is rain gear on the bottom, notebook carrrier with all the usual work stuffs, additional paperwork, and the laptop.

This bag was MAINLY bought for its HARD back with an internal laptop sleeve that was sewn a few inches above the bottom of the bag. I had a previous bag where the laptop sleeve went all the way to the bottom of the bag, 
and now i have a edge dented laptop as the bag was set down ever-not-so-gently. 

The lid pouches are a work of dark magic I think, the internal and external pouches are seemingly bottomless and are perfect for all the little "quick need to haves"; headlamps, cell chargers, keys, cards, glasses, sunglasses, zyn, markers, gloves, etc.

The second reason this one was bought to replace my old bag was that it can zip from top to bottom on both sides. Enough bag dumps trying to get the thing that always seems to be at the bottom of the bag regardless of how you packed it.

I've hunted with it a few times; seemed a little big for that, but I don't carry that much stuff in the first place I guess. 

Other things: fits perfectly in an overhead compartment on planes (under the seat too if you ditch the center outer pocket), I don't have any opinion on using it as its intended purpose, that of a "trekking" backpack. I don't use it for that and have never worn it for longer distances than through
a large airport. It's comfy enough. I removed the waist belts as soon as I got it, so can't speak to those things. I've never used the rain fly as, again, I don't use it for trekking for fun. It's a work bag. 

It's a fantastic bag. Been using for about two years and which I had it for the past 15. Probably would still be standing where the others have fell by the way side.
review.name: A perfect work bag (field and office)

review.reviewBody: I have had this pack for three years now in Colorado. I hike every week, hunt, and fish, and this pack goes with me every time. Best pack I have ever owned. Hands down.
review.name: The best

review.reviewBody: With the added pouch attachments, it's the perfect size for day hunting with the ability to strap your rifle to the back or side. My only complaint is the color of the rain cover. Fine for hiking but a matching green would have been ideal.
review.name: Excellent day pack

review.reviewBody:
Tent, mat and bag in the main compartment. Accessories in the top pocket. Food, water and cooking stuff in the optional side pockets.

Perfect.
review.name: Fantastic Day Hike or Quick Overnight Camp Bag

review.reviewBody: This pack does not have two critical features for heavy loads.  It lacks an adjustable torso length, so the distance between hips and the shoulders is accommodated by the shoulder strap entirely, secondly, the pack lacks load lifters meaning that heavy loads will rotate the pack off the wearers back leaving a gap at the top of the shoulders and not transfer sufficient weight to the hip belt.  Needs adjustable torso and load lifters.  Recommend that there also be a square shaped pocket accessory for the front if/when those other design issues are addressed.  Would also recommend a non-UN Blue rain cover... for the entire Singi series.
review.name: Light duty only

name: Singi 28L Backpack

description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Indie Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Indie Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mystery Ranch Indie Bag online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I spent a forever looking for a good quality bag and I came across this one that checks off everything. I use it every day whether it would be going out or heading to work. You can fit a lot in here and it will not put weight on your shoulders. Two things that  threw me off but I didn’t mind is that 1.) the velcro pouch makes a lot of noise and it would be better if it had a zipper and 2.) I got the bag in hummus and it doesn’t match the color in the image. It looks more like grass green than a cream beige color. Despite this, I still love my bag 100000/10 :)
review.name: My all-time favorite bag

review.reviewBody: Love the bag for around town or traveling. Perfect for essentials.
review.name: Perfect Size

review.reviewBody: It’s difficult to tell how large this bag actually is from photos. It holds slot of stuff. If you are a small build person this bag could overwhelm you. I use it as a photography gear bag, everyday. It is holding up, very durable fabric. I expect this bag to last longer than the one it replaced. I holds a small light, batteries microphones iPhone and paperwork nicely. I like the strap simple adjustable. For the money, it’s great. I’m thinking of getting one more.
review.name: Durable and roomy!

review.reviewBody:
Nice fabric, nice strap, hits a sweet spot for size — small enough to be unobtrusive, big enough to stash a water bottle and a camera or jacket — and the rear zipper pocket is very useful. 

Unfortunately the front pocket is secured with velcro and it's a failure. In order to fully upen the pocket, one needs to use both hands and it makes a lot of noise when the wide center hook strip lifts away. As the hook strips at each end are thin, however, a thief could easily lift one up and slip their hand inside. A zipper would've been much more secure and more convenient.
review.name: Would be five stars with a front zipper pocket

review.reviewBody: Great material....Portable and compact...lots of pockets and storage.
review.name: Compact...Durable...light weight

review.reviewBody: I wanted something like a very small messenger bag for traveling that would be pick-pocket proof.  This is a great travel pocketbook, but a bit lightweight and small for what I needed
review.name: Not quite what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: We went on vacation and used this as my EDC bag instead of my backpack.  The indie was able to carry all my necessary items with no issues and it was easy to access them when I needed them.
review.name: Excellent EDC

review.reviewBody: I use this as as my everyday carry bag and use it as a gym bag. I love this bag!
review.name: perfect simple little bag

review.reviewBody: I have been looking for a bag that fits my needs for so long but the search is over thanks to this bag. It has shape, which many bags are so floppy and I don’t like that. It has many inside and outside compartments. So well made and attractive. I am so happy with this purchase.
review.name: The perfect bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a grab and go workout bag. Nicely made and perfect for what I needed it for.
review.name: Nice travel size

name: Indie Bag

description: Buy the Kakadu Outback Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Outback Shower
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kakadu Outback Shower online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Not sure if this is a model issue or a unit issue but I pre charged the unit a few days before my trip from wall outlet so it would be ready to go when I needed it on a week long camping trip.  When I went to use it there was no charge available.  Plugged it in to a solar generator to charge it and then had very little run time.  Charged it again and then after another day the unit had lost almost all of its power.  Probably a great unit for plug and use, but when power is limited I need more reserve power.
review.name: Didn't Work for Me

review.reviewBody: I used the Kakadu shower on a 4 day overland trip through SW Colorado and was extremely impressed. The terrain was insanely dusty so to be able to clean off each day prior to getting in the tent was a game changer. We also used the Kakadu for cleanup each night. Washing dishes with hot water was mind blowing. The unit heats up in no time at all and maintains a constant temp.
review.name: So far so good.

name: Outback Shower
Outback Shower

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been looking for an alternative to gym shoes, for those cold days, when there's no snow on the ground.  I thought I hit the jackpot when I saw these.  I decided to order the velvet tan/sanguine for fun and the black to be practical.  I normaly wear a 11.5M, so I figured I'd better order the 12M.  Right out of the box, the tan/sanguine color was just stunning.  But, as soon as I put these boots on my feet, I was like, "What the heck!?!?!"  These boots were so tight I had to double check the box and tongue, to make sure I got size 12.  I'm not sure in what universe this is a 12M, but they aren't in mine.  Depending on what size you wear, I'd caution against ordering these, unless you can go up at least 1.5 sizes.  Sadly, these are going back.
review.name: Beautiful boot, but runs small
comment: Hello Stu, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our ONA AVE™ Alpine Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Cute but the insole is already coming out after only wearing for a few hours. Very disappointed in the quality of these since I have been a diehard Sorel wearer but the quality of these is lacking.
review.name: Poor Quality
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots for winter! The perfect upgrade for the ug style chunky slip on with the warmth and waterproof features of Sorel. So much more practical and fashionable!
review.name: Perfect chunky warm waterproof winter boot!

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Worst quality and terrible sizing. I ordered half a size up the first time I ordered these and they were normal but fit too small. So I reordered a full size up and both boots were deformed. The left boot has something poking out of the top on the inside that immediately hurt my foot as I tried it on. The right boot crushed my foot and was even smaller than the first size I purchased. They also had scuffs and loose threads. How in the world are these boots getting out into the world with no quality control? I'm so incredibly disappointed.
review.name: Just No
comment: Hello angie26, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our ONA AVE™ Alpine Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: My new favorite boots! Love the style and color. They are the most comfortable winter boots, very warm, great traction. I sized up a half size based on other reviews. I’m normally 7.5 I purchased an 8. The 8 fits great! If you’re looking for a great everyday winter boot I highly recommend these. I’m tempted to get a second pair in another color.
review.name: Great Boots

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Such cute boots but they run so small. Go up at least half size. Maybe even a whole size.
review.name: Cute boot but they sun very small.
comment: Hello Boots, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our ONA AVE™ Alpine Women's Waterproof Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Super cute and warm and waterproof but they def run small- i would recommend going up a minimum of a half sixe

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these boots they are so cute! I did have to re-order twice though! I usually wear an 8 and they were too small near the toe, so I re-ordered an 8.5. Unfortunately they were still a little too snug so I ended up sending them back for a 9. They are amazing shoes though, so cute and very comfy. I've worn them two days in a row all day and they felt great and I got a lot of compliments
review.name: Love but ran a little small

review.itemreviewed: Ona Ave Alpine Felt Synthetic WP Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the RockyMounts HighNoon FC Solo 1.25/2in Hitch Rack online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Just received this bike rack today and appears to be high quality and capable of handing the weight of my electric bike. Folds up nicely when not in use which is a big plus since most heavy duty bike racks are threaded connections to the hitch, which makes taking it on/off a pain. Comes partially assembled already so it didn’t take much work to finish the assembly.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody:
Very sturdy, easy to use rack. Nice it comes with locks for both the rack and bike. 

My E-bike is about 50 lbs  and I don’t see much movement at all while carrying the bike. 

My one criticism so far is that the bike kickstand is on the left side of bike when loading which makes it difficult to get into position to lift. It would be nice if the rack was reversible. 

Also I haven’t yet been able successfully to put one wheel at a time on the rack (to lessen the weight). Still working on it but it doesn’t seem conducive.
review.name: High Noon rack

name: HighNoon FC Solo 1.25/2in Hitch Rack

review.reviewBody: Bought this for rowing/fly fishing and an upcoming trip to Chile. True to size with a slightly bigger fit making it perfect for layering in the cold and just loose enough as the day warms up, you don’t sweat.
review.name: Exceptional quality!

review.reviewBody:
I got this anorak as a present last year and I love it.
You may hear or read comments from different people saying that it doesn't work as a raincoat and they are absolutely right, but neither does a dress shoe work as a running shoe.
The G-1000 fabric works perfectly under heavy duty conditions, you wont need to repair this coat anytime soon and when the first hole appears you'll be counting the years you've had it with both hands. 
Apply Greenland wax (properly) if you want some resistance to light rain and windy days but don't expect it to perform as a rubber raincoat because it's not made out of rubber nor is it a raincoat. 

Absolutely recommend this product.
review.name: What you would expect from Fjallraven's G-1000

review.reviewBody: Very nice except it’s missing a zipper on the kangaroo pocket which is kind of dumb since you by nature put an anorak upside down twice every time you wear it.
review.name: Great with one exception

review.reviewBody: Drawcord snapped after the second wear. Poor quality for the price paid
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: Is not rain proof, shoulders and tops of arms get wet even with the wax for the price very disappointed stick to Buffalo from now on.
review.name: Poor in the rain
comment:
Hi Aj! We are sorry to hear about your disappointment!

This jacket is made out of G-1000, which is not a waterproof fabric.
As the product description states, it is considered to be water resistant. However, water resistance means that the fabric itself is acting as the barrier between you and a light rain shower. Tightly woven fabrics offer a degree of water resistance because it takes some time for water to seep through the material.

You can read more about the different stages: https://foxtrail.fjallraven.com/articles/waterproof-vs-water-repellent-vs-water-resistant

The Greenland Wax offers the garment a higher level of water-resistance, but unfortunately not waterproofness.

review.reviewBody: It's basically perfect. I can see why people unfamiliar with Fjallraven g-1000 and their philosophy around waxing might be upset that it's not giving them Gore-Tex performance, but that's exactly why I like it. I have all kinds of membranes for situations where I'm trapped in downpours, but the thing I love about this anorak is that it's breathable and durable, and if I so please, I can add wax (which ins't what I want--this is an urban jacket for me). All the details are spot on; I like the firm grip of the snap that allows you to use the size zipper to dump heat rapidly. There's no silver bullet all-situations jacket out there, so it's not the fault of this product that people have specific qualities it never attempts to pitch. I love mine, and no, will not be using it as a rain jacket.
review.name: Basically Perfect

review.reviewBody: Great coat for a hunt, wicked good hood,! And still stylish enough for around town.   Im happy
review.name: Exactly what i thought it would be

review.reviewBody: This jacket is amazingly functional and I love the adaptability! The fit is relaxed but very well fitted for athletic builds. I love all the pockets and pouches and the functional sleeve buttons. Truly my new favorite jacket!!!
review.name: New Favorite Jacket

review.reviewBody: Excellent. Well designed and great quality. It’s quite loose and has space to wear layers underneath. Very practical and looks great. The zipper at the side provides good ventilation and access to pocket of any garment you wear underneath. Can be waxed to retain its water resistance.. Got a feeling this one will have longevity.
review.name: Great quality, looks and practicality.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Vardag anorak, when I first wore it in the rain it allowed water to penetrate the garment, I bought some wax and applied it as per the recommendations, this didn't work either, it's very expensive for a rain coat that actually doesn't stop rain from soaking your clothes and skin underneath. Pretty useless and not fit for purpose, money wasted do not buy!
review.name: Not fit for purpose, not waterproof

name: Vardag Anorak - Men's

description: Buy the Saucony Guide 16 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Guide 16 Running Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Saucony Guide 16 Running Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been rocking the Guides (15/16) for a few years now and I love them. This shoe felt more narrow than the usual guides. I have narrow feet and this still felt snug, so if you tend to have wider feet I would suggest looking into the wide. After a few runs it loosened up, but not much. I use these on my longer runs +8miles and do like the support they give my heel and foot because I pronate on one foot.
review.name: Narrow Shoe but Good

review.reviewBody:
I bought this and only put on a few times. 
When I stepped on the street after the rain, me feet became wet immediately. 
It looked like water was getting inside the shoe through the sole. I guess I got a defective pair. Disappointed
review.name: Possibly defective pair
comment: We're sorry to hear about your experience and would like to help in any way we can. Give the team a ring at 800.282.6575. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I am never disappointed with Saucony. The running shoes are the best. The guide line is my favorite. My arches are collapsing and the stability with this line is the best
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

review.reviewBody: I've have bought Saucony's for many years now as my feet never hurt when I run in Sauconys and they are extremely light. I am always surprised how the fit of each new iteration is different. I actually prefer the fit of older models. For this particular shoe, I would like some more internal height in the shoe. It fits pretty snug now so I'm not sure how comfortable it will be when it gets colder and I wear thicker socks. Not sure if I like that one special lace but don't hate it either.
review.name: New isn't always better.

review.reviewBody: I have a similar pair of the shoes. I ordered the same size but they are uncomfortably narrow.
review.name: Comfy but Narrow.

review.reviewBody: I train for 1/2 marathons and these shoes work perfect. I've been wearing Saucony for 30 years.
review.name: Feet perfect for my narrow feet
comment: Thanks for the awesome 5-stars!

review.reviewBody: Skip it!  Tread fell off while out on a walk, even before that though it wasn’t a comfortable shoe, I’ve bought this line before but this was a bad year or something.  I was able to get a refund thankfully, trying the Ride line now.
review.name: Fell apart and not comfortable , made my feet ache

review.reviewBody: Do not buy this shoe!  The inside sole is soo structured and supportive with no or very weak support in the outter foot causing your ankle to roll.   This sneaker has caused me a lot of pain.   Never had a problem with saucony before.   All they did was offer 30 percent off a different pair.   So I went back to everun.   But still stuck laying 90 for these hazard on sale!   Do better saucony.  Take this shoe off the market! It’s dangerous.
review.name: Hazard

review.reviewBody: supportive, light and comfortable right out of the box. Love it!
review.name: Perfect running shoe

review.reviewBody: I love my Guide 16 shoes. They are the best walking shoe I’ve ever had!
review.name: Best shoes ever

name: Guide 16 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've used GU for years and always loved it. After a time gap  I bought some,  Espresso Love, which seems to be an updated version of what I used to use. It's great! It's like I can feel it flowing in my veins! If you like the dark chocolate and a little caffeine combo, this is it!
review.name: GU packs I love yhem!

review.reviewBody: I needed a Cliff Shot replacement so I tried these (with caffeine).  Pleasant taste, easy to get down, and seemed to add the boost I needed.  Would have been 5 stars, but I am not a fan of the packaging.  When you rip open the top, there is no where to put the small tab. I thought the Cliff Shots with the attached tab were easier to avoid littering.
review.name: Great Replacement

review.reviewBody: Yes you can make your own bike food. But why? I slurp one GU every 30 minutes and I never bonk. That's 3 GUs for a 2 hr ride at intensity. They stuff easily into the jersey pocket, as do the empties. I wish they sold mixed packages of 24 because it's easy to tire of one flavor, no matter how tasty, and all flavors provide the same instant energy. It's really amazing how fast they work. So go ahead , make your own food and save money. I don't want to wait 20 minutes for my calories to kick in, and then lose speed unraveling my homemade wrappers and then dealing with the garbage. I'd rather pay the money, slurp my GU, get and get virtually instant energy on the fly.
review.name: Anti-Bonk Perfection

name: Energy Gel - 24 Pack

review.reviewBody: I’ve been using this bib for over six months and I’m really happy with it. I don’t feel the sizing is off at all. I am 5’8” and 125 lbs and usually wear a small in leggings and pants from other brands and find that the small here fits well. I don’t mind the straps that have to go over your head. I wouldn’t have designed it like that, but it’s not bad. Many other ski bibs are like this. I like the long zipper down the side for ease of undressing for those quick restroom visits without having to take off your top layer. The pockets at the hip are convenient as is the chest pocket. The material has stood up to many days on the mountain without tears or snags, and I’ve skimmed a tree and taken a few nasty spills.  But the most important factor is it keeps me warm and dry while on the slopes without adding bulk! Would purchase again!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I was really excited to find these bibs on sale along with the Nora long puffy Jacket w belted waist. I’m a pear shaped woman w larger hips and smaller waist. I got them today and they're going back unfortunately. I was afraid this might happen looking at the other reviews. My measurements correspond to the size chart and they’re so small. I’m surprised/disappointed as HH is a mainstream brand ! for reference
review.name: sizing off!

review.reviewBody: What were HH designers thinking when they crafted the idea for this bib? Suspenders don’t disengage making bibs awkward and very hard to put on. Sizing is way off. I am returning and going to size up but that might not even be enough to provide adequate bend in the knees and accommodate base layers. I like the vents inside v. Mountain Hardware side vents. I just don’t understand the design and how the overall bib is suppose to be relaxed.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: I sized up from what the measurement said, and it was still too small. They also weren't fitted well around the lower leg. I also didn't like that there's only one side for the zipper and disliked that there's no way to unhook the suspenders. It makes it awkward to put the pants on. Overall, I think the pants could've had more utility to them, but they're just basic snow pants, really.
review.name: Not sized accurately

review.reviewBody: I am 5' 6", 135 pounds, size 4-6/medium. Moving up a size to large for these was the right choice. Unfortunately, I had to return them because the button on the side above the zipper immediately came off when trying them on at home.
review.name: Button came off immediately

review.reviewBody:
Loved these bibs so much. I usually wear a small at 5'3, but these are snug, and no room for any baselayers, so I have to return them.
Great blue color.
review.name: So small

review.reviewBody: I ordered these and I was SO excited! However, they are way too small and I could barley put them on. I am a size 4 and ordered a Medium! So disappointing
review.name: Way too small

name: Legendary Insulated Bib Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I struggled to find a pair of boots to replace my trusty H.H Brown boots of yore. After some extensive research I settled on the Baffin Borealis boots and I could not be more pleased. I was a bit hesitant of the double-boot system but I find the boots quite comfortable and extremely warm. As noted in a previous review, do not wear thick socks. You will struggle to get them on and your feet will become cold. The lace system is top notch. These do not come undone as the hook eyelets "lock" your laces in.  I have used these for two seasons now and they have not disappointed. I have not experienced wet feet as noted in a previous review and not for the lack of trying. The only "issue" if I had to call it one is that these fit so well, I used to struggle to get them on. I found a stand up shoe horn and now they slip on with ease.
review.name: Best winter boots I have owned

review.reviewBody:
Review below mentioned how they can get wet, which they can if water leaks between the shell and the neoprene tongue. If you take some seam sealer and get that seam packed up, these boots are then 100% waterproof from the top down.

You can also use an oven bag or food vacuum sealer bag to line the boot outside of the liner, which also makes the boots 100% waterproof as any water that does get past the seams will not get into the insulation.

As far as the boots performing in general, think of them as the lightest and most walking-friendly double boot system out there. They're like the trail runners of double shell and liner winter boots. They hike very comfortably.

For cold days, since these boots are very form-fitting without a lot of sloppy room for thick socks, you are best off with thinner wool or synthetic socks for staying warm. If you wear socks too thick in these boots, it can cut off circulation and make the toes colder. 

I use mine primarily for wet weather and snow sports like snowshoeing and cross country skiing. I have the Black Diamond Glidelite 147 XC skis which are like snowshoes in that they strap onto just about any boot.
review.name: Great snow boots. Work in rain too.

review.reviewBody: I thought I found the perfect, warm, winter hiking boot. Unfortunately, on the first hike through wet underbrush, my feet got wet. Luckily temperatures were in the upper 30's F. Great customer service from Backcountry though accepted a return even though I had thrown away the box after making sure the fit was good.
review.name: Wet Feet
comment: Hey there! Thanks for your review!  I'm so sorry to hear about your experience with the boots you received, I'm glad we were able to get you sorted with a return!

name: Borealis Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought the yellow color and absolutely love the fabric and fit. The grid tech fabric keeps me warm but it’s breathable so I don’t ever feel stifled and hot. I’ve gotten compliments every time I’ve worn it and it’s always with me in case I feel chilled. I work in a hospital setting so it’s frequently very cool at night. I’d love to see a full zip version of this jacket!! For me I have a long torso and long arms and I appreciate that I can use the thumb holes without feeling like it being pulled at the shoulder. It’s just fantastic.
review.name: My new go to for comfort and warmth

review.reviewBody: It’s useful and just ok. The sleeves are a little odd, though. I’ve never had sleeve length be an issue on a medium fit, but these seem ridiculously long.
review.name: I mostly like it.

hasVariant.name: LOX Pack Mount
hasVariant.description: Buy the RotoPaX LOX Pack Mount online or shop all Overlanding from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very nice design with some security. I do ride an adventure bike and do off-road quite a lot- I'm a bit concerned about dirt infiltrating the lock so I'll cover the lock with duct tape until I need to release it.
review.name: Nice design

review.reviewBody: This mount holds the pax just as well as the original, but it gives you the peace of mind that your pax will be there when you return from stepping away from your bike.
review.name: Great upgrade idea on the original mount

review.reviewBody: It is winter and I am prepping for spring riding with the purchase of the lockable mount for the rotopax can I got for Christmas. I have not been able to use it on the bike yet, however the mount is clearly very solid and I trust will last a lifetime. I was slightly disappointed that the locking handle is taller than the recess in the can, not leaving a flush surface for strapping other items to the can. I will be ordering the standard handle as well so that times when i am not worried about a locking handle I can have a flush surface to strap things to the can.
review.name: New purchase impressions

name: LOX Pack Mount

description: Buy the Mountain House Rice & Chicken online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rice & Chicken
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain House Rice & Chicken online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This taste is pretty good but rice is A little chewy. That said, I would get this again.
review.name: Tasty except rice was A little chewy .

review.reviewBody: Easy and tasty anywhere in the mountains or the lakes
review.name: Easy food Great scenes

review.reviewBody: My 14 year old son is a very picky eater and I was worried about him going on his first high adventure trip in Boy Scouts. We tried this and he absolutely loved the rice & chicken! He got through his 8 day trip and did not starve. The BSA camp even had this on hand for other scouts as well! Extremely tasty and filling.
review.name: Satisfies A Picky Eater

review.reviewBody: This was a great meal. The seasoning is good. It could use a little more chicken for texture.
review.name: Rice and chicken

review.reviewBody: Delicious. But, I have to have a certain character length. <sigh>
review.name: One word says it all:

review.reviewBody: Easy to make, pour in boiling water and wait 5min, stir and let sit another 4min, then eat. Smells fantastic during the wait, ton of flavor and definitely filling. Excellent recipe, will buy again. My 7yr old loved it.
review.name: Great Recipe!

review.reviewBody: The rice and chicken is very good. This meal pairs up well with other MH meals to make a complete dinner for two.
review.name: Tasty choice for lunch or dinner

review.reviewBody: We bought this to try before adding it to our list of good things and it did not disappoint.  Taste is good and is filling.  We did, however, add some extra chicken to the meal as it was a bit scant.  Otherwise another keeper!
review.name: Good Meal

review.reviewBody: Mountain House chicken and rice never disappoints ! You just can’t beat a warm meal while hunting in the snow country
review.name: One of my favorite meals

review.reviewBody: I bought several defrent variaties and was pleased that many are gluten free. The chicken and rice is one of my favorites. Recent power outage gave me an excuse to dive in. I wasn't disappointed and as a matter of fact, I found myself making more even when the power came back on. I have celeac desease and knowing that many varieties are GF sold me. Very Delicious products indeed. Knowing I have this wonderful food supply is great for my morall nowing I don't have to sacrifice flavor and calories. To sum up the chicken and rice.... OUTSTANDING!
review.name: Not just for camping anymore!

name: Rice & Chicken

hasVariant.description: Buy the CamelBak Dirt Series Podium Chill 21oz Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm happy not to drink muddy water with cow poop from riding in the backcountry. Great quality, as usual, from Camelbak. It is slightly thinner than other Camelbak bottles, but they fit perfectly in my endurance bike holders. However, depending on the holder, it fits a little loose in the MTB bike holder. Overall, it's an appropriate size. And, yes, insulation works great.
review.name: Great for muddy/dusty rides

review.reviewBody: This bottle is just like other Podium Chill options, but the decisive factor is the cap.  Having ridden crazy amounts of gravel, dirt and adventure type miles with these.  I love not having to worry about s#!t being all over the mouth piece.
review.name: the cap is crucial for H20 purity

review.reviewBody: Great water bottle ! Love having the spout covered so you don’t have to clean it off every time you need a drink .
review.name: Definitely chill !

review.reviewBody: This bottle does a good job of keeping water cold.  Depending on the outside temp it seems to keep ice for over an hour.  I wish there was a gasket where the top of the bottle meets the cap.  If the cap is not very tight it will drip when squeezed
review.name: Nice Bike Bottle

review.reviewBody: They are awesome! I bought them because of wet, muddy bike trail and my spout stays clean and protected! Best purchase!!!
review.name: Excellent cap feature!

review.reviewBody: The best is how cool the bottle keep the liquid for long time
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Awesome bottle, does exactly what it's supposed to.  I like that I can lock the cap to prevent accidentally squeezing the contents out of the bottle.  The dust cap works wonderfully as the trails are dusty and I don't want to be drinking dirt.  The bottle does a good job insulating, because I like ice cold water.  Keep it mind it's not a vacuum insulated metal bottle, but it does well.  If I fill it with ice, then water it will last at least 4-6 hours in 80ish degree weather before the ice completely melts.
review.name: Great bottle!!

review.reviewBody: Bought mainly to sit in bottom of boat while rowing - so, cap cover keeps the spout clean. Also, new design makes cleaning easy. Have only used for brief period; however, so far has worked well
review.name: Great features.

review.reviewBody: Fit perfectly in holder. It isn't the prettiest (the insulation looks bunched, realized all brands look like that) but does the job. Rode through some nastiness and really glad there was a cap to keep it clean! Loved being able to enjoy some clean COLD water :)
review.name: Awesome water bottle!

review.reviewBody: Works very well for mountain biking to keep the mud of the mouthpiece
review.name: Great dust cover

name: Dirt Series Podium Chill 21oz Bottle

review.reviewBody: This is literally the best board I have ridden in 20+ years of snowboarding. The reason I say that, it makes the entire mountain fun, which I hope is why we all snowboard. I was skeptical at first, is this a powder board, is it some niche thing that will sit in my snowboard collection and collect dust. It is exactly the opposite. I want to ride this board everyday and everyday that I ride it, it is amazing. I can take this out on ‘Link Laps’ with my kids and then go charge hard the next day with my compadres. And best of all, this board makes each turn feel soulful and satisfying.  What more can you ask for? And the same goes for the Cardiff Crew. I would buy any board from them, because the stoke they have, shines through in the products they make. Amazing board, amazing people. If you can find anything better than that, please let me know where.
review.name: Best Snowboard I have ridden in 20+years

name: Powgoda Solid Enduro Snowboard - 2025

review.reviewBody:
New Booster climbs great and can be super comfy because of the dreamy materials and softness. It is the nicest built shoe I've ever used. I'm an 11.5 or 12 street shoe and 45 is very tight, very high toe curl fit

Performance is awesome. Plenty of big toe power even though it is a really soft, sensitive, sticky feel. I'd pick a stiffer shoe for really sustained front pointing
review.name: Amazing soft + aggressive shoe

review.reviewBody:
Been using these for a few months now. They have great sensitivity and precision, much more than other stiffer shoes I own. You can really feel the footholds and gives me a lot of trust in my feet. I primarily use them for rope climbing, but are pretty good for bouldering as well.

Sizing: I normally wear a 43 street shoe, I ordered a 41.5 in these. Took about a month of climbing to fully break in. They were pretty painful at first, primarily due to your big toe being pushed up against the rubber of the top toe box. After they stretched some, they have a really good fit for my feet, and are fairly comfortable and form to my feet very well. I would probably advise against sizing down as much as I did to avoid the pain of the break in period. I have another pair of scarpas that I ordered 1 size down and they fit pretty well and are slightly more comfortable but still a snug fit.
review.name: Great shoes
